aws::graph::propositions: # Meteorological Information and Flight Plan for Accident
Conditions at the accident site were Visual Meteorological Conditions (VMC).
The condition of light at the accident site was night.
The observation facility was KSBA.
KSBA is at an elevation of 20 feet mean sea level.
The observation facility was 1 nautical miles from the accident site.
The observation time was 05:53 local time.
The observation facility was 225 degrees from the accident site.
The lowest cloud condition was clear.
Visibility at the accident site was 10 miles.
There was no ceiling at the accident site.
No wind speed or gusts were recorded.
No wind direction was recorded.
No turbulence type forecast or actual was recorded.
No turbulence severity forecast or actual was recorded.
The altimeter setting was 30.06 inches of mercury.
The temperature was 8 degrees Celsius.
The dew point was 2 degrees Celsius.
There was no obscuration at the accident site.
There was no precipitation at the accident site.
The departure point was Santa Barbara, California (SBA).
No flight plan was filed.
The destination was Long Beach, California (LBG).
No clearance was issued for the flight.
No departure time was recorded.
The airspace was Class C.

text:
# Meteorological Information and Flight Plan

Conditions at Accident Site: Visual (VMC)
Condition of Light: Night

Observation Facility, Elevation: KSBA,20 ft msl
Distance from Accident Site: 1 Nautical Miles

Observation Time: 05:53 Local
Direction from Accident Site: 225

Lowest Cloud Condition: Clear
Visibility: 10 miles

Lowest Ceiling: None
Visibility (RVR):

Wind Speed/Gusts:  /
Turbulence Type Forecast/Actual:  /

Wind Direction:
Turbulence Severity Forecast/Actual:  /

Altimeter Setting: 30.06 inches Hg
Temperature/Dew Point: 8C / 2C

Precipitation and Obscuration: No Obscuration; No Precipitation

Departure Point: Santa Barbara, CA (SBA )
Type of Flight Plan Filed: None

Destination: Long Beach, CA (LBG )
Type of Clearance: None

Departure Time:
Type of Airspace: Class C

---
